image.altText: Former Port Adelaide footballer Warren Tredrea at Alberton Oval.

props.synopsis: AFL great Warren Tredrea has been dismissed from the board of the Port Adelaide Football Club, the Power has confirmed.

title.children: Port Adelaide dismisses Warren Tredrea from board of directors

image.altText: The old Snowtown bank.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Parole Administrative Review Commissioner will start hearing submissions in December as to why Snowtown killer James Vlassakis should not be released on parole.

title.children: Commissioner to hear submissions on why Snowtown killer should not get parole

image.altText: A sign that reads algal bloom in south australia, visiting the beach is safe, in front of a sandy and grassy beach

props.synopsis: Coastal towns in parts of SA's south-east have seen significant drops in visitation, despite being free of harmful algae.

title.children: SA coastal tourism down, even in towns without algae

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Work is underway to drain a dam at the outback property where the missing four-year-old was last seen more than a month ago, as police say they'll "continue to search for Gus for as long as it takes".

title.children: Police drain dam 'out of an abundance of caution' in search for missing 4yo Gus

image.altText: A smiling man stands near a beach with a black top and cap

props.synopsis: Six months ago, Jack Atkinson had little running experience. But this weekend he will tackle the world's largest marathon alongside NRL great Johnathan Thurston and AFL giant Lance 'Buddy' Franklin.

title.children: SA runner to join NRL, AFL greats at New York Marathon

image.altText: Oyster farmers as part of their blockade at Haslam.

props.synopsis: Oyster farmers have formed a blockade at Haslam in South Australia to prevent oysters from an area affected by the algal bloom being put in the waters around Streaky Bay.

title.children: Oyster farmers blockade trucks carrying oysters from algal bloom waters

image.altText: Crime scene tape at Redwood Park.

props.synopsis: The mother of 26-year-old Amy Bowden, who died after her partner injected her with methamphetamine, has told an Adelaide court the man "played Russian roulette with her life" instead of getting help.

title.children: Man 'played Russian roulette' with girlfriend's life, grieving mum says

image.altText: Three greyhounds that race on leads at a track in Victoria.

props.synopsis: Many of the racing clubs slated for closure are in regional Australia, including at Broken Hill, where the loss of its club will mean the closest track is nearly six hours away.

title.children: Almost half of all NSW greyhound racing tracks to be permanently shut

image.altText: Aerial view of a dam surrounded by dry ground in the middle of the outback

props.synopsis: The owners of Anna Creek Station, the biggest cattle station in the world, have been charged over allegedly building illegal dams on inland rivers and waterholes in outback South Australia.

title.children: Cattle station owners face charges over alleged illegal dams

image.altText: 80-year-old Aboriginal women sits in the desert playing guitar, flanked by a young boy

props.synopsis: Icons, innovators, and unexpected gems — WOMADelaide's 2026 line-up promises a truly unique festival experience.

title.children: From Yothu Yindi to Iron & Wine — WOMADelaide's line-up is here

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: More than 50 people have been arrested and charged with more than 800 offences in a major Operation Ironside sting across South Australia linked to the encrypted AN0M app.

title.children: More than 50 arrests in organised crime sting across SA

image.altText: Australian currency including $50 and $100 banknotes.

props.synopsis: South Australian police charge two people with deception after they allegedly found more than 30 counterfeit notes — as well as an imitation firearm and a machete — at a home on Yorke Peninsula.

title.children: Two arrested over fake money allegedly found at SA home

image.altText: A street sign that reads 'Slag Street'.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill resident Sid Siddall worries a lack of signage could result in emergency services being unable to find him the next time he needs urgent help.

title.children: Slag Street resident pleads for people to stop stealing his sign

image.altText: An orange mesh bag full of oyster shells.

props.synopsis: A marine ecologist's discovery two years ago sparked a restoration project and has become a key element in South Australia's response to a devastating algal bloom.

title.children: The key role a 'lost' reef is playing in SA's algal bloom fight

image.altText: Two cranes constructing a big hospital project behind a road

props.synopsis: The South Australian government's three costliest hospital projects have all had "delays in starting construction", according to the auditor-general — but the health minister says they remain on schedule.

title.children: SA's three biggest hospital projects delayed, auditor-general says

image.altText: Andrew Bolt in a suit and tie at a desk in a TV studio, looking into camera.

props.synopsis: Senior managers at the National Broadband Network intervened to accelerate a home internet upgrade for News Corp pundit Andrew Bolt and resolve a technical problem for a top executive's friend during the final stages of the infrastructure project's rollout.

title.children: 'Throw the kitchen sink at it': NBN Co fast-tracked upgrade for Bolt

image.altText: Banner protesting wind farm proposals

props.synopsis: There are grave concerns that dangerous language and bullying of farmers who are hosting renewable energy projects on their properties could turn into violence.

title.children: 'It's gotten out of hand': Wind farmers fear threat to turn to violence

image.altText: A uniformed police officer stands outside a suburban home.

props.synopsis: Police investigating the death of an eight-month-old baby at a Baldivis home charge a 28-year-old woman with murder and say she will face court at a later date.

title.children: Woman in hospital after being charged with baby's murder in Perth's south

image.altText: A green cricket helmet sits on a fence at a cricket oval.

props.synopsis: Following the death of 17-year-old Ben Austin, experts, including the former doctor for the Australian cricket team, say more focus needs to be put on neck protection at all levels of the sport.

title.children: Calls for mandatory protection in cricket after tragic Melbourne death

image.altText: Hundreds of men wearing suits and hats crowded in a street and in buildings.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of ultra-orthodox Jews have shut down one of the busiest junctions at the entrance to Jerusalem in protest against moves to force them to serve in the Israeli military.

title.children: 'We are against its mere existence': Ultra-orthodox Israelis reject country and army service

image.altText: Hands beside a dinosaur footprint.

props.synopsis: From dinosaur footprints to volcanic eruptions, First Nations knowledge is helping to drive modern science.

title.children: Song cycle led scientists to hidden dinosaur tracks

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tams and Penguins on a table.

props.synopsis: Food manufacturers are responding to high cocoa prices, and a change to the UK's Penguin biscuit may have all but cemented Australia's Tim Tam as the better of the two.

title.children: UK's rival to the Tim Tam can no longer be called chocolate

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Press Club speech

props.synopsis: Labor came to power in 2022 promising a new form of transparent, accountable politics. As recent incidents have shown, there is little sign of it.

title.children: Albanese government 'leans into a culture of secrecy'

image.altText: a man poses for a photo with his arms over the shoulders of an older woman and a young woman

props.synopsis: On Halloween night in 1936, the tiny, white-haired widow of Harry Houdini made her final attempt to contact him from beyond the grave. Today, the tradition continues.

title.children: Even after the 'final' seance, psychics still try to contact Harry Houdini

image.altText: David Pocock stands in the Senate.

props.synopsis: Independent Senator David Pocock warns extended Senate question time will continue until Labor releases a secret report.

title.children: Pocock issues threat to Labor on Senate games — as it happened

image.altText: A young woman and an older lady smiling

props.synopsis: The mother of 21-year-old Finley Bone, who was struck by lightning and later died, says her daughter's life was "taken away in a minute".

title.children: Lightning strike kills talented sportswoman on soccer field

image.altText: A woman with a shaved head and floral dress sits at a table.

props.synopsis: Yorgos Lanthimos continues his journey as the king of absurdist dark comedies with this latest offering, which delves into conspiracy theories in the most bizarre way.

title.children: Emma Stone shaved her head for Bugonia, but that's just the beginning

image.altText: A Palestinian child walks past a mural warning against approaching unexploded ordnance.

props.synopsis: Many Palestinians returning to what is left of their homes face the risk of unexploded bombs hidden under rubble, which aid groups say may take decades to clear.

title.children: Gaza is now an 'unmapped minefield' littered with unexploded bombs

image.altText: People with their fists raised

props.synopsis: Historic legislation has passed that will see the creation of an Indigenous council that will be consulted on laws and policies affecting Indigenous communities.

title.children: Australian-first treaty legislation passes in Victorian parliament

image.altText: the torsos of two young children in school uniforms

props.synopsis: Unveiling its choice for word of the year, Dictionary.com explained that it was not quite sure what six-seven meant.

title.children: Gen Alpha's viral 'six-seven' named word of the year

image.altText: A life-size bust of Julius Caesar.

props.synopsis: It is time to see if you have been paying attention — test your memory of this week's news cycle here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: History exams, an unusual gift and the 'storm of the century'

image.altText: ANZ logo

props.synopsis: The Australia share market is higher on Friday but still on track for a weekly loss. ANZ has flagged a $1.1 billion profit hit due to redundancy costs and fines. Follow live.

title.children: ASX on the rise but ANZ shares fall on profit hit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AGL speeds up energy transition following hundreds of job losses announcement
Australia's Mayne Pharma falls as treasurer considers blocking Cosette's $672 million bid

image.altText: Alyssa Healy walks from the field after being dismissed in Women's World Cup semifinal.

props.synopsis: Australia captain Alyssa Healy says her side only have themselves to blame as the defence of their World Cup crown comes to an end.

title.children: Aussies rue batting and fielding mishaps in World Cup semi loss to India
